column5: On Sunday I headed out with one of the usual suspects to chase some late winter square tails.  After a brief detour to ascertain some forgotten snowshoes, we were headed out of town by 5 am.  By 9 am we were fishing.  Things started off slow but true to form, this lake produced the first speck shortly after 10 am.    Fish were very selective in the early a.m. taking only jigged presentations tipped with minnows.  From 11 am until 1 pm fishing was fairly steady and we managed to ice several chunky fish - including a 2lber and a 3+ I lost fumbling with it at the hole.  Note to self, keep camera closer.        Throughout the day we had regular visitors...these whiskeyjacks kept stealing our lunch and bait...    It was a pretty good day.  Tomorrow is pinnin' for steel and ice fishing for brookies!  Good luck this weekend folks!
Right on man, looks like a nice day to walk there.  Nice fish!
Nice brookies! Almost time for some spring chunkers!
Not a soul in sight.. Nice fish

Beauty fish!  Some guys at work were telling me they did really well last weekend up in the park too.  Now I'm definitely going up to the park this weekend, suppose to be be -14 in Wawa tonight, should tighten everything up pretty good!
i didn't say it was the park did I?
Nice fish, congrads!  MTBF
It was if you were walking...nice fish  PS...I liked the "not a soul in sight" comment
you mean the crowds don't hike 15km in a day by snowshoe to fish?
beauty day! beauty fish!
i don't know if any of y'all noticed, but i'm wearing my adidas.  not to often can you wear shoes in your snowshoes, then wear your kicks all day on the lake.  beauty day indeed wd.
i wear my running shoes all winter in these http://www.overshoe.com/recreational/produ...tail.php?s=N5PS

15 k or 15 yards, there just aren't the crowds up here. Most places, cept for haviland and trout lake, you get the lake to yourself  And don't be too sad about losing the 3 lber...they ain't all that good a eating anyway
Nice look'n feesh!  I love the darker looking fish, just darn perty Cheers,
Grear report and pics Dr. S Some real nice ones you guys got into April 23rd can't come soon enough Thanks for sharing Leechman
Great specs and pics!!!
Hey, in one of your pics I saw Mr. Williams on the ice.....is that your secret weapon??   LOL!

My secret weapon that day was a swedish pimple tipped with a full dace however my fishing partners secret is an old battered williams that was his grandfathers.  He always uses it!  On days when he's outfishing me he'll often tell me that "yours is missing the tarnish"...
Yah I kinda noticed it looked like one of the vintage ones......Which are diifferently shaped if you look at them closely!
Beauty specks Dr... Im looking forward to seeing some of your steelhead pics this spring.  TDunn
hopefully i can get some this evening...you had any luck yet?
Yep landed the first one on march 18 this year.... I'll be in the rapids this evening after class, you heading north?
yeah i'm gonna go check out in and around where you and pikeie were last week.
Nice, definitly fish in that river...Good luck man
